title: Environmental Education Design Applying Self-Regulation Theory: Promoting Sustainable Behavior

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science knowledge and general understanding of environmental issues
context.additional_context: Immersive environmental issue experiences and expert role-playing through VR simulations

learning_goals: Learners can design environmental problem-solving strategies based on the three core elements of self-regulation theory (autonomy, competence, relatedness).
Learners can analyze the social impact of environmental behaviors through group discussions and propose actionable alternatives.
Learners can make sustainable decisions while performing expert roles in VR simulations and evaluate the outcomes.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
